p.s: The given scene has a distinct function for the movie.
In the course of the scene the viewer is introduced to the cohesion of the Carter's family.
Moreover the given scene presents Maverick as a loving father, who tries to protect his family (here especially Maverick) in every way.
The scene presents Starr as the witness and her effect on her environment.
The scene to be analysed especially presents the cohensioncohesion of Starr and her family in each way.
The praying and the close ups from Starr's, Lisa's and Maverick's face emphasizesemphasize the loving family.
Moreover Starr's Thank you for my family shows the family keeping together.
The close up shows her happy and thankful expression.
The calm and melodical music is used to underline the grateful family who seems hopefullhopeful and happy.
Moreover the warm colors create a comfortable and calm atmosphere.
As Starr notices King outside the restaurant her facial expression changes.
This is done by a big close up.
The music changechanges to a dramatic background music clarifies Starr's anxiety again.
The slowly zooming in of King emphasizes danger and Starr's fear.
Maverick is presented as the loving father he is and leaves the restaurant as soon as he notices King too.
The atmosphere directly changes as Maverick goes outside and yells.
He is shown in a long shot and the camera moves with him.
When they start to fight, the camera follows them and makes a 180 degree move with them.
By doing so, the hectic, trouble and anger of Maverick are emphasized and the fact that Maverick tries to protect Starr is underlined.
When the police car arrives, the blue and red lights create a cold but also dangerous atmosphere.
The officers seem very violent which also is emphasized of the hectic camera moving.
The black officer is the one who pulls Maverick on the ground, even he has not seen the fight.
The brutality of the police causecauses the worried expressions of the family.
When Maverick lays on the ground the close up'sups from the faces clarifiesclarify their worryness and their purpose to fight for each other.
The family cohesion is reflected again.
As soon as the officers notice that Starr is the witness the music gets quiet and they stop being violent.
The mid-shot of the black officer clarifies his worried expression.
The mid-shot of Starr who films the whole pull-over demonstrates her worryness but also her anger against the police.
In summary one can say that the given scene foreshadows the anger of King, because Starr told in the interview about the drugs he sells in Garden Heights.
The purposes of the given scene are clearly presented and underlined with camera movements and effects.
The family cohensioncohesion, Maverick as a loving father and Starr who effectsaffects her environment with the fact that she is the witness clarifies in the course of the scene.
